comments.text:
Created attachment 8949261
drop-down bug.gif

The behavior of drop-down menus are inconsistent with the expected behavior when you hold the mouse button down and then lift up to make your selection. 

This means that, when opening a drop-down menu, you must click, let go, and then click again in order to make a selection. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

1. Open a page that has a drop-down menu (like a new bug window in Bugzilla)
2. In a drop-down menu, click and hold your mouse button to open the menu, and move the mouse to one of the options
3. Release the mouse button on the new selection

*Expected Results*

The item that was highlighted when you released the mouse button should be selected. 

*Actual Results*

The item that was highlighted when you released the mouse button is not selected, and no change is made to the drop-down menu.
comments.author: justin@getpocket.com

comments.text:
Aside from the macOS version (10.13.2 vs 10.13.3), are there any other differences between the two systems? Such as external mouse vs. integrated trackpad? Could you check if an external mouse still reproduces this on the MacBook Pro?

To run mozregression, it should be as simple as running the three commands below in a Terminal window:

sudo easy_install pip
sudo pip2 install -U mozregression
mozregression

A number of Firefox versions will open in succession to narrow down when this started occurring. Simply type "good" or "bad" in Terminal based on whether or not a build reproduces the bug.

comments.text:
Yeah -- unfortunately it seems like the Nightlies from the "fix range" (and earlier) simply don't exhibit the bug. :-/ Quoting comment 6:
> mozregression-spawned Nightlies from 2018-01-20 and 2017-11-13 are fine and don’t exhibit the bug.

Note that 2017-11-13 is the day that Nightly switched from version 58 to 59, per https://wiki.mozilla.org/RapidRelease/Calendar .  So given that latest 58 release and 59beta are both affected, then that build should've shown the issue, IF this were reproducible in Nightlies.  Therefore, since it doesn't show the issue, it seems like this isn't reproducible in Nightlies -- and hence, we can't really use mozregression effectively & we can't be sure it's really fixed.
